result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Seric E. Rehbein

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on January 13, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

(2:58 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Seric E. Rehbein appeared by video, in custody in the Racine Correctional Institution. Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Seric E. Rehbein. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Attorney Schmidt advises the parties are jointly requesting a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI) and Psychosexual Evaluation be ordered.
Attorney Schmidt also advises the parties are jointly recommending a sentence as follows:
Count 6: 10 years Initial Confinement followed by 20 years Extended Supervision to be consecutive to any sentence currently serving (15CF936).
Count 7: 10 years Initial Confinement followed by 15 years Extended Supervision to be concurrent to Count 6 and consecutive to any sentence currently serving (15CF936).
Attorney Schmidt outlines the requested conditions of Extended Supervision.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 6: Repeated Sexual Assault of a Child without Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offender and Amended Count 7: Incest without Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offender.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 6 and Amended Count 7.
Parties advise the Court with reasoning for PSI request and joint sentencing recommendation prior to PSI being ordered.

Court orders a PSI and Psychosexual Evaluation be completed and any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court orders the PSI is due by December 13, 2022.
Sentencing Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 1:15 pm in person (hour and a half), defendant may appear via Zoom.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Status conference on September 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(Case called at 2:33 PM)
Defendant Seric Rehbein appears in custody via videoconference from Racine Correctional Institution.  Attorney Karl Schmidt appears in the courtroom.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense still waiting on discovery from the State (State still waiting on law enforcement).  Defense requests another status conference in about 1-2 months.  
Status Conference: September 6, 2022 at 10:30 AM (30 minutes; Defendant can appear by Zoom if personal appearance is waived; If not, Defendant to notify attorney so transport order can be prepared)
Order Granting Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum for a hearing on 07/14/2022 at 2:30 p.m.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(Case called at 11:38 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Seric E. Rehbein appeared by audio, in custody from Racine Correctional. Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Seric E. Rehbein.  Attorney Matthew Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of Information, waives reading, enters Not Guilty pleas. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Court receives Not Guilty pleas and orders 20 days for motions. 
Status Conference: 07/14/2022 at 2:30 PM. (Zoom for Defendant if no agreement)

2:12 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Seric E. Rehbein appeared by video, in custody from Racine Correctional Institution.  Attorney Katherine Cook on behalf of Karl A Schmidt in court for Seric E. Rehbein. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
State calls Detective Don Henning to testify- is sworn.
State asks the court to find all counts transactionally related to one another as they relate to M.L.R. between the ages of 4-7 and have some form of sexual contact with M.L.R. 
There is no objection from the Defense. Court finds all counts are transactionally related. 
Detective Don Henning testifies. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by the witness. 
Cross-examination by the Defense. Witness excused. 
State asks for bind over. Defense reserves argument. 
Court finds probably cause and binds matter over for ARGN in branch 2.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:52 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Seric Rehbein in court via video from Racine Correctional. Defense waives reading of the complaint. Defendant given information for the SPD office. 
Preliminary hearing 5/17/22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with M.R., her family, school, or residence, or any minors.
No use of internet except for employment or legal defense reasons.

Conditions:
No contact with M.R., her family, school, or residence, or any minors.
No use of internet except for employment or legal defense reasons.

(11:14 AM case called.) Reserve Judge William Gabler for Branch 1 Intake. 
Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Seric E. Rehbein appeared by video, in custody in the Racine Correctional Institution.
Defendant advises doesn't have a copy of the complaint.
Court goes through the complaint with the defendant.
State advises will fax a copy of the complaint to the defendant at Racine Correctional today and requests to adjourn initial appearance to tomorrow.
State also advises will contact the State Public Defender Office and advise the defendant will be appearing tomorrow for an initial appearance.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
